item.title: Reclaiming myself
item.description: It is time to stop running. Hey there. This thing still work? It’s been quite a while since I was on here. My history tells me that the last time was all the way back in January, and even so, there’s hardly anything there that I’d consider noteworthy. So I guess we can start with a blank slate, now. Lots has happened since then, and I can’t help but feel weirdly on edge, like things have fallen in place in a very specific way, as if the world is giving me a sign.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi! I’m Ashe O. Hawkes, and I love games, and I love to make ’em! Inspired to make games since the age of 11 and with 5 years of professional experience, I’ve picked up a multitude of skills in service of that goal. Be it designing and developing complex systems, or setting up a pipeline to facilitate a smooth development process, I can bridge the gap between the worlds of art and engineering.

item.title: Contact
item.description: I generally respond in 2-12 hours. Please contact me via: E-Mail: surfacedfox@gmail.com Discord: @surfacedfox LinkedIn: surfacedfox Telegram: surfacedfox Twitter/X: @surfacedfox

item.title: Projects
item.description: Here are some projects I’m proud of! XScape, a realtime 3D data visualisation client, which is an integral part of the award-winning 4-Dimensional Disease Outbreak Surveillance System project. I have been working on this one at my job for a little over two years now, and it’s actively in use right now by a major hospital in Singapore! I worked on Adorae during my time at Hopscotch games. I personally took initiative to implement and design full gamepad controls for this game, which was keyboard + mouse only at the time, and designed and developed some of the minigames you see here.
